On Wed, Apr 22, 2009 at 6:19 PM, Solomon Duskis <sduskis@...> wrote:
> troels, "REST is always based on HTTP"?  I think you just opened a can of
> worms...  Roy Fielding specifically stays away from HTTP specific
> implementation details :).  There are plenty of implementation that use
> RESTful ideas without HTTP.

Judging from the rest of the replies, so it seems. I hadn't really
though about it that way. Do you have any examples of rest outside of
http?

Nice list you got here, by the way.

--
troels
